name: Vegan Crab Cakes
description: Made with hearts of palm and chickpeas, these flaky Vegan Crab Cakes take minutes to cook in a skillet, air fryer, or oven. Top them with lemon aioli for an explosion of flavor!
recipeIngredient: 15 ounce can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
15 ounce can hearts of palm, drained and rinsed
1/2 large red bell pepper, seeded and finely diced
3 tablespoons vegan mayo (I use Follow Your Heart brand)
3/4 cup panko breadcrumbs (check ingredients to ensure vegan)
1/4 cup fresh chopped dill or parsley

recipeInstructions.text: In a food processor, add the chickpeas and hearts of palm to a food processor. Pulse a few times until broken down a bit but not smooth. You want to leave a lot of texture.
recipeInstructions.name: In a food processor, add the chickpeas and hearts of palm to a food processor. Pulse a few times until broken down a bit but not smooth. You want to leave a lot of texture.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small pan, sauté the red bell pepper and onion over medium heat in a tablespoon of olive oil until translucent and softened, about 3-4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small pan, sauté the red bell pepper and onion over medium heat in a tablespoon of olive oil until translucent and softened, about 3-4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the red bell pepper and onion to the bowl with the chickpeas/hearts of palm, along with the vegan mayo, dijon mustard, old bay seasoning, salt, black pepper, panko breadcrumbs and dill/parsley. Mix until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the red bell pepper and onion to the bowl with the chickpeas/hearts of palm, along with the vegan mayo, dijon mustard, old bay seasoning, salt, black pepper, panko breadcrumbs and dill/parsley. Mix until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Form into about 8 patties, about 1/2 inch thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Form into about 8 patties, about 1/2 inch thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large pan (non stick or cast iron preferred) with a thin layer of oil. Fry the patties for about 4-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large pan (non stick or cast iron preferred) with a thin layer of oil. Fry the patties for about 4-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer cooked patties to a plate lined with paper towels or a clean dish towel to soak up the extra oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer cooked patties to a plate lined with paper towels or a clean dish towel to soak up the extra oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Lemon aioli: In a small bowl, whisk together the vegan mayo, lemon juice, sweet pickle relish and salt + pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Lemon aioli: In a small bowl, whisk together the vegan mayo, lemon juice, sweet pickle relish and salt + pepper to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the vegan crab cakes with lemon aioli and enjoy! Leftovers will keep in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Reheat in a pan on the stove, the air fryer or oven to make them crispy again.
